title: Understanding Data Validation
text: Data validation is a feature in spreadsheet applications that allows you to control what can be entered into a cell. It helps ensure that the data entered meets certain criteria or rules.

title: Logical vs. Mathematical Errors
text: Logical errors occur when the formula is syntactically correct but doesn't produce the desired result. Mathematical errors occur when the formula is incorrect in terms of mathematical operations.

hintAnswer: identifies formulas that are logically incorrect, but not the ones that are mathematically incorrect
title: Identifying Logical Errors
text: Data validation can help identify formulas that are logically incorrect, but not the ones that are mathematically incorrect. Which option best describes this function?
choices: identifies formulas that are logically incorrect, but not the ones that are mathematically incorrect
identifies formulas that are mathematically incorrect, but not those that are logically incorrect
identifies cells that are logically incorrect or mathematically incorrect
